title: 10 Years After Lac-Mégantic Tragedy, Are Canada’s Rails Safe?
description: When a runaway train loaded with oil jumped the tracks in Lac-Mégantic, Quebec, 47 people died in Canada’s worst rail disaster in nearly 150 years.

title: Russia, Ukraine and the West Vow to Fight On, in a War With No End in Sight
description: Moscow and Kyiv face daunting challenges in moving forward, with no clear sense of what an attainable victory might look like.

title: 10 Years After Lac-Mégantic Tragedy, Are Canada’s Rails Safe?
description: When a runaway train loaded with oil jumped the tracks in Lac-Mégantic, Quebec, 47 people died in Canada’s worst rail disaster in nearly 150 years.

title: Zelensky Answers Reporters’ Questions for Over 2 Hours
description: On the anniversary of Russia’s full-scale invasion, Mr. Zelensky offered a broad overview of where the war stood, the challenges Ukraine faced and the opportunities in the months ahead.

title: China Reprises Old Themes in Ukraine Plan, Casting Itself as Neutral
description: A year after Russia’s invasion, Beijing released a paper declaring its position on the war: It called for an end to the fighting but avoided demands that could hurt its ties with Russia.

title: Nigerian Politician Arrested With Nearly $500,000 on Eve of Election, Police Say
description: For years, Nigerian politicians have been accused of buying votes. The lawmaker, the police say, was caught with dollar bills and a list of possible recipients.

title: BASF to Cut 2,600 Jobs After a Year of High Energy Costs
description: The German chemical giant blamed a drop in profits on stubbornly high natural gas prices and shifting global demand.

title: What I’m Watching, Weimar Noir Edition
description: “Babylon Berlin” is the TV show I can’t stop thinking about.

title: U.S. Eyes Trade Deals With Allies to Ease Clash Over Electric Car Subsidies
description: The Biden administration has faced backlash in Europe and Asia over its plans to bolster electric vehicle and battery production.

title: Ireland Cheers Paul Mescal for Embracing Irish Language
description: On the red carpet for the British Academy Film Awards, the Oscar-nominated actor gave an interview in Ireland’s national language.

title: Six Ways the War in Ukraine Changed the World
description: The ripple effects of Russia’s invasion have reordered lives and upended economies. Here are some of the consequences.

title: Yellen Confronts Russian Officials at G20 Meeting
description: In a private session, Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen said the Russians were “complicit in Putin’s atrocities,” according to remarks shared by a U.S. official.

title: A United Front
description: Western unity could have consequences beyond Russia’s invasion of Ukraine.

title: Live Updates: On War’s Anniversary, Messages of Support and Resolve
description: “We were not defeated,” President Volodymyr Zelensky said in a speech to the Ukrainian people. As world leaders expressed solidarity with Ukraine, the Pentagon said it would spend $2 billion to supply Kyiv with new drones and anti-drone systems.

title: The Times invites readers to reflect on the war in Ukraine.
description: Share your reactions and observations about the conflict.

title: The French Like Protesting, but This Frenchman May Like It the Most
description: Jean-Baptiste Reddé has hoisted his giant, colorful signs in nearly every street protest for over a decade, embodying France’s enduring passion for demonstrations.

title: New York Times Photographers in Ukraine on the Images They Can’t Forget
description: In a year of war, New York Times photographers have reported from the front line, from cities and villages and in the footsteps of refugees. These pictures stayed with them.

title: Photos: Shows of Solidarity With Ukraine Around the World
‘It’s Complicated’: How Biden and Zelensky Forged a Wartime Partnership
description: The relationship between the two leaders has become critical to the future of the international order.

title: Kidnappings in Nigeria and Other Security Crises Concern Voters Ahead of Election
description: Nigerian voters say that insecurity is the most important issue in this week’s presidential election. One man who was kidnapped said, “You can only survive on your own in Nigeria.”

title: Sphere on Japanese Beach Was Just a Buoy, Experts Say
description: Experts said the sphere that washed ashore, leading to speculation about espionage, was nothing special. “Maybe everybody is paranoid because of balloons,” one said.

title: 5 New(ish) Australasian Books for Your Reading List
description: Great reads you might have missed.

title: China Repeats Call for Cease-Fire in Ukraine and Peace Talks
description: A new policy paper  was not the blueprint or bold initiative that some in European capitals appeared to expect.

title: Yellen Confronts Russian Officials at G20 Meeting
description: In a private session, Treasury Secretary Janet L. Yellen said the Russians were “complicit in Putin’s atrocities,” according to remarks shared by a U.S. official.

title: Your Friday Briefing
description: The war in Ukraine, one year in.

title: Shattered Homes and Lurking Disease: Quake Hardships Pile Up
description: Hundreds of thousands are sheltering in tents, breathing air thick with pollutants unleashed from tombs of rubble, fearful that a new disaster could strike at any moment.

title: The U.S. Intelligence Playbook to Expose Russia’s Ukraine War Plans
description: Bolder disclosures are part of a larger effort to stymie the Kremlin’s offensive in Ukraine and align support for Kyiv’s war effort in allied countries.

title: U.S. Sends Home Brothers Held for Nearly 20 Years at Guantánamo Bay
description: The latest release, of two Pakistanis never charged with a crime, reduced the detainee population of the once-sprawling prison complex to 32.

title: After A Year of War, Ukrainians Have Learned How to Judge Lethal Threats
description: After a year of war, people in Ukraine have become adept at telling which threats are probably not deadly, leaving room for a little enjoyment, and even hope.
